result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L E Wilkerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered all applicable court costs, fees, surcharges, provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and pay the DNA surcharge within 90 days from today's date. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
With credit for 30 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never possess a firearm or body armor and his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Charles L E Wilkerson in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Charles L E Wilkerson in custody.  Kevin Shomin for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

AS TO COUNT 1:   Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, with 30 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER COURT ORDERS (AS TO COUNT 1):
- Court ordered all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges to be paid within 90 days from today's date.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY the DNA surcharge within 90 days from today's date.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Defendant Charles L E Wilkerson in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Charles L E Wilkerson in custody.  Kevin Shomin for Michael Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
Per the Return on Warrant Hearing on 07-22-2016.

Case adjourned to 08-25-2016 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

All cash bail on deposit to be forfeited.
2-25-2016 date for plea/sentencing  is VACATED.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear and has not received notice of today's date.  Defendant has been non-compliant with Justicepoint conditions.  State is requesting a bench warrant; defense is requesting time to contact defendant via mail as phone number is disconnected.  Court will STAY a bench warrant to 2-9-2016 at 8:15 in Branch 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Charles L E Wilkerson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Christopher Allen Liegel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

css
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Charles L E Wilkerson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Charles L E Wilkerson in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
